org.midica.ui.widget

Class FlowLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollPane
            • org.midica.ui.widget.FlowLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants

    public class FlowLabel
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane

    This class provides a replacement for a JLabel that enables smoother word wrapping of long texts and scrollbars when needed.

    It’s actually a JScrollPane containing a JTextArea that’s modified in order to look more or less like a JLabel.

    The height of the label is automatically adjusted to the containing text. However it can still be limited to a certain value by calling setHeightLimit(int).

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

      • FlowLabel

        public FlowLabel(java.lang.String content,
                 int charsPerLine,

        Creates a new FlowLabel.

        Parameters:

        charsPerLine - The estimated number of characters fitting in one line.
        prefWidth - The designated width of the label.

    • Method Detail

      • makeFontLookLikeLabel

        public void makeFontLookLikeLabel()

        Makes the font look like in a JLabel.

      • adjustHeight

        private void adjustHeight()

        Calculates and remembers the preferred height of this component. This calculation is based on the number of line breaks in the text, and also on the lines that are longer than the charsPerLine and their lengths.

      • getPreferredSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()

        Overrides the parent’s method in order to adjust the dimension to the text content. If setHeightLimit(int) has been called before with a positive value, the preferred height will never be larger than that value.

        In other words: This method tries to make the content big enough so that scrollbars are not necessary. But the height can still be limited to a smaller value.

        Overrides:
        getPreferredSize in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • setHeightLimit

        public void setHeightLimit(int height)

        Sets the maximum height of the label. Calling this method with a positive height makes sure that getPreferredSize() will never return a dimension with a height higher than height.

        This should be used if the text can be so large that the layout is in danger.

        Parameters:
        height - Height limit for the preferred size of the label.

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground(java.awt.Color color)

        Sets the background color.

        Overrides:
